p: To predict the native landscape cover distribution, we selected nine different species distribution methods and three ensemble forecastings. Each ensemble was composed by a different group of methods: (i) bioclimatic envelope and distance-based models–BIOCLIM [ 43], Gower distance [ 44], Mahalanobis distance [ 45]; (ii) statistical models—Generalized Linear Models (GLM) [ 46], Generalized Additive Models (GAM) [ 47], Multivariate Adaptive Regression Splines (MARS) [ 48]; and (iii) machine-learning models—Maximum Entropy (MaxEnt) [ 49], Genetic Algorithm for Rule Set Production (GARP) [ 50], random forest [ 51]. Details on these methods can be found in [ 52, 53].
